entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Jun 03 - Jun 09, 2019
entry.content:
PlaygroundBooks

  • Image Filtering (‚≠ê82) - A Swift playgroundbook about Image Filtering. üçÅüåü
  • Neural Network (‚≠ê58) - A Swift PlaygroundBook about Neural Networks. üçÅ

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Mar 25 - Mar 31, 2019
entry.content:
Mathematics / SpriteKit

  • Guilloche Pattern Playground Book (‚≠ê21) - Learn more about this pattern you see every day, but probably never knew it was really carefully designed. üçÅ

PlaygroundBooks

  • Accessibility (‚≠ê5) - Accessibility for iOS developers. üçÅ
  • TJBot Playground (‚≠ê37) - Swift Playground for interacting with IBM's TJBot. üçÅ

Learning Swift

  • What's new in Swift 4 (‚≠ê1.8k) - An Xcode playground showing off the new features in Swift 4.0. üçÅ üåü
  • What's new in Swift 4.2 (‚≠ê870) - An Xcode playground showing off the new features in Swift 4.2. üçÅ üåü
  • Codable Playground (‚≠ê19) - Playground that demonstrates advanced uses of Codable. üçÅ
  • Generics In Swift - Playground that explains generics. üçÅ
  • Swift String Cheat Sheet (‚≠ê61) - A quick guide to using Strings with Swift. üçÅ
  • About Swift (‚≠ê84) - A playground about Swift language. üçÅ

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Design Patterns

  • The Principles of OOD in Swift 4 (‚≠ê1.9k) - The Principles of OOD based on Uncle Bob articles.üçÅ

Theoretical Computer Science / Functional Reactive Programming

  • Functional Debug View (‚≠ê38) - Playground to visualize functional programming with graphical sequences. üçÅ üåü
  • OOP with Functions in Swift (‚≠ê59) - Object-Oriented Programming in Functional Programming in Swift. üçÅ

Theoretical Computer Science / Algorithms and Data Structures

  • Animated Sorting Algorithms (‚≠ê36) - Swift 4 playgrounds to view and manipulate sorting algorithms.üçÅ
  • Expressions (‚≠ê396) - Arithmetic and logical expressions elegantly modeled and visualized using protocol-oriented binary trees.üçÅ

Theoretical Computer Science / Languages

  • Introduction to Compilers (‚≠ê473) - Great introduction to the inner workings of compilers. üçÅüåü
  • Pascal Interpreter (‚≠ê286) - Simple Swift interpreter for the Pascal language inspired by the Let‚Äôs Build A Simple Interpreter article series. üçÅ

UIKit And Graphics / SpriteKit

  • SceneKit ARKit Demo (‚≠ê49) - The Xcode 9 ARKit SpriteKit demo as a playground.üçÅ

Playground Sets / SpriteKit

  • Parks And Recreation (‚≠ê177) - Great collection of interesting playgrounds, for fun and for profit. üçÅüåü
  • URaimo's Playgrounds (‚≠ê139) - My playgrounds, various topics. üçÅ

Miscellaneous / SpriteKit

  • Rubik's Cube (‚≠ê21) - Implementing basic model and behavior of Rubic's Cube in Swift. üçÅ
  • SwiftChain - Simple Cryptocurrency in a Swift Playground.
entry.summary: 21 awesome projects updated on Mar 25 - Mar 31, 2019

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Jan 14 - Jan 20, 2019
entry.content:
PlaygroundBooks

  • AudioKit Playground Book (‚≠ê194) - A set of playgrounds using AudioKit designed for the iPad Playgrounds app.

Audio / SpriteKit

  • Miles (‚≠ê34) - A Swift Playground that creates jazz improvisations in any key using AudioToolbox and AVFoundation.

Libraries and APIs / SpriteKit

  • AudioKit Playgrounds - 130+ Audio synthesis, processing, playback, and analysis playgrounds with AudioKit.
entry.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Jan 14 - Jan 20, 2019

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Apr 09 - Apr 15, 2018
entry.content:

  • GOF Swift (‚≠ê138) - Learn all 23 Gang of Four patterns using Swift.

UIKit And Graphics / SpriteKit

Mathematics / SpriteKit

  • Abstract Algebra (‚≠ê191) - Abstract algebra concepts implemented in Swift.

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Dec 25 - Dec 31, 2017
entry.content:
PlaygroundBooks

  • Spacetime Rhapsody (‚≠ê27) - A Swift Playground visualizing gravity based on Einstein's Theory of General Relativity. üåü

UIKit And Graphics / SpriteKit

  • Astronomy (‚≠ê34) - A 3D earth model written in swift playground using SceneKit.
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Dec 25 - Dec 31, 2017

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Nov 20 - Nov 26, 2017
entry.content:
PlaygroundBooks

  • Tree Trouble Playbook (‚≠ê25) - An interactive Swift Playground Book about Binary Search Trees.
  • Auto Pong (‚≠ê13) - A tutorial to implement a pong based on a simple AI.
  • Neural Network Playground (‚≠ê382) - A neural network Swift playground, with no third party dependencies.
  • Window Manager Playground (‚≠ê39) - Playground for an experimental window manager.
  • Numsw (‚≠ê133) - A swift playground book that mimics some of the features of numpy and jupyter notebook.
  • File Browser Playground (‚≠ê205) - Simple File Browser for Swift Playgrounds on iOS.
  • Geometry with Swift (‚≠ê10) - In this course your students will learn the fundamentals of Swift 3 programming, using geometry as their context for learning.
entry.summary: 7 awesome projects updated on Nov 20 - Nov 26, 2017

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Oct 23 - Oct 29, 2017
entry.content:
Learning Swift: Advanced Topics

  • Swift Regular Expressions (‚≠ê12) - A playground to learn regular expressions with Swift.
  • Network Stack (‚≠ê34) - Clean & simple Swift networking stack playground.

Apple's Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

  • Apple's Balloons Playground - The balloons playground showed at WWDC14. ‚è≥

Theoretical Computer Science / Algorithms and Data Structures

  • A Star (‚≠ê41) - Protocol oriented A* pathfinding algorithm implementation in Swift 4.üçÅ

UIKit And Graphics / Animations

  • Duet-Inspired Trail Effect (‚≠ê26) - How to get a Duet style trailing effect in SpriteKit.
entry.summary: 5 awesome projects updated on Oct 23 - Oct 29, 2017

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Sep 18 - Sep 24, 2017
entry.content:
Apple's Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

  • Interactive Newton's Cradle (‚≠ê10) - Apple's interactive playground of a Newton's Cradle where collisions and gravity are applyed with UIKit dynamics. üåü (updated to Swift 3 by @p-sun)

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on Aug 21 - Aug 27, 2017
entry.content:
Theoretical Computer Science / Languages

  • Let's build a compiler in Swift (‚≠ê163) - Let's Build a Compiler by Jack Crenshaw translated to Swift Playgrounds. üåü

UIKit And Graphics / Metal

  • Metalbrot (‚≠ê92) - Interactive playground that draws the Mandelbrot fractal with Metal. üåü

Playground Sets / SpriteKit

  • Mgrebenets's Playgrounds (‚≠ê9) - Various playgrounds.c üåü
  • Cocoa With Love Playgrounds (‚≠ê89) - Playground versions of select articles from Cocoa with Love. üåü

Miscellaneous / SpriteKit

  • Pixel Art Maker (‚≠ê118) - A playground where you can make pixel art.
  • SwiftCoin (‚≠ê33) - A simplistic blockchain & cryptocurrency in a playground.
  • SentimentlySwift (‚≠ê13) - Sentiment analysis in Swift.
entry.summary: 7 awesome projects updated on Aug 21 - Aug 27, 2017

entry.title: Awesome Swift Playgrounds Updates on May 29 - Jun 04, 2017
entry.content:
Learning Swift

  • The Swift Programming Language Playgrounds (‚≠ê228) - 40+ playgrounds, one for each chapter of Apple's Swift book. üåü
  • Swift Hack Pack (‚≠ê23) - Collection of playgrounds that teaches Swift.
  • The Swift Summary Book (‚≠ê1.7k) - A summary of Apple's Swift language. üåü
  • Swifter Tips (‚≠ê124) - Examples for every feature of the Swift language.
  • MPCS51032 UChicago iOS Course (‚≠ê7) - Playgrounds from the 2017 Spring iOS course of the University of Chicago.

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics

  • A Swift Introduction to Core Data (‚≠ê154) - Learn Core Data experimenting directly in this playground. üåü
  • TDDSwiftPlayground (‚≠ê58) - Demonstration of using Swift Playgrounds in Test Driven Development with XCTest.
  • Concurrency on iOS (‚≠ê32) - Concurrency and Parallelism in iOS.
  • Modern Core Data (‚≠ê35) - An introduction to Core Data.
  • Swift DSL Example (‚≠ê20) - Implementation of a DSL in Swift.
  • Katan (‚≠ê25) - A micro web server that replies "Hello world!" to every request, an example of how to use sockets in Swift.
  • Swiftly Typed Resources (‚≠ê74) - A playground showing how Swift makes Strings, Colors, Fonts, Images, etc easier to deal with. ‚è≥
  • Swift KVO Closures (‚≠ê11) - Swift KVO playground. ‚è≥
  • Swift Date Tutorial (‚≠ê8) - Learn everythig about NSDate. ‚è≥
  • Swift And C (‚≠ê6) - Examples about using C with Swift. ‚è≥
  • Swift Memory Management (‚≠ê3) - How to avoid retain cycles, from this post. ‚è≥

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Design Patterns

  • Design Patterns Playground (‚≠ê27) - Learning GoF's Design Patterns in Swift 3.
  • iOS Design Patterns (‚≠ê140) - Sample projects for MVC, MVP, MVVM, and VIPER.
  • Design Patterns in Swift (‚≠ê15k) - Design patterns in Swift 3.

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Protocol Oriented Programming

  • Swift Diagram Playgrounds (‚≠ê277) - Adaptation of the Protocol-Oriented Programming in Swift talk from WWDC 2015.
  • Swift Protocol Extensions (‚≠ê20) - A playground to explore Protocol Extensions. ‚è≥
  • Battleship Example (‚≠ê13) - An example of how to use Protocol Oriented Programming with the battleship game. ‚è≥

Learning Swift: Advanced Topics / Functional Reactive Programming

  • ReactiveCocoa Playground (‚≠ê97) - The easiest way to get a taste of ReactiveCocoa. ‚è≥
  • Swift Reactive Playground (‚≠ê27) - Companion to the article: ReactiveCocoa made Simple With Swift. ‚è≥

Apple's Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

  • Apple's Mandelbrot Playground (‚≠ê24) - A playground with the mandelbrot fractal (updated to Swift 3 by @palmerc, @kemalenver).
  • Apple's Crustacean Playground - Protocol-Oriented Programming with Value Types. ‚è≥
  • Apple's Swift Standard Library Playground - experiment with Swift standard library types and high-level concepts using visualizations and practical examples. ‚è≥

Playgrounds about Playgrounds / Functional Reactive Programming

  • XCTest Playground (‚≠ê54) - Better looking tests for playgrounds.
  • Interactive Playground (‚≠ê53) - Exploring interactivity in Playgrounds.
  • Mondrian (‚≠ê4) - Make iOS app mockups in Swift 2.x playgrounds. ‚è≥

Playgrounds from Playgroundbooks / Functional Reactive Programming

  • iPad Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê28) - The sample playgroundbooks converted to playgrounds.

Theoretical Computer Science / Functional Reactive Programming

  • Logician (‚≠ê197) - Logic programming in Swift. üåü
  • Function Composition in Swift (‚≠ê58) - Exploration of function composition in Swift. üåü
  • Swift Adventures in Monad Land (‚≠ê172) - Learn about monads.
  • Functional Design Patterns (‚≠ê5) - A few functional programming concept and patterns.
  • Learn about transducers (‚≠ê80) - A little tutorial that explains transducers. ‚è≥
  • Swift Functors, Applicatives, and Monads in Pictures (‚≠ê68) - Companion to the article: Swift Functors, Applicatves, and Monads in Pictures. ‚è≥
  • Functors in Swift (‚≠ê6) - A playground to introduce Functors in Swift, and their practical usage. ‚è≥

Theoretical Computer Science / Algorithms and Data Structures

  • Swift Algorithm Club (‚≠ê29k) - Algorithms and data structures in Swift with explanations. üåü
  • Sorting Experiments - Alluring experiments with sorting algorithms in Swift, sort of.
  • Visual Binary Trees (‚≠ê58) - Effortless visualization of arbitrary Binary Trees, along with their pluggable traversal implementations. üåü
  • Julia Fractal Playground (‚≠ê261) - A Swift playground that generates beautiful Julia set fractal images.
  • DataStructures Playground (‚≠ê16) - Data Structures and Algorithms in Swift. ‚è≥
  • Swiftography (‚≠ê8) - Standard cryptographic algorithms in a Swift Playground. ‚è≥
  • Algorithms Playground (‚≠ê6) - Various algorithm implementation in Swift. ‚è≥
  • The Jelly Bean Problem (‚≠ê2) - The Jelly Bean problem from Wait But Why. ‚è≥
  • Euclidean Strings (‚≠ê1) - A playground leveraging ReSwift to generate Euclidean Strings. ‚è≥

Theoretical Computer Science / Languages

  • Write your own language: Mu (‚≠ê1k) - A playground explaining how to create a tiny programming language named Mu. üåü
  • ASM Swift (‚≠ê106) - A playground for learning Assembly language through Swift. üåü
  • Register VM (‚≠ê9) - A register-based VM in a Swift playground. üåü ‚è≥
  • Turtle Playground (‚≠ê126) - A playground with Logo-like commands. üåü ‚è≥
  • Swift Brainfuck (‚≠ê9) - Brainfuck interpreter written in Swift using Playground. ‚è≥

UIKit And Graphics / Machine Learning

  • UIStackView Playground (‚≠ê328) - Interesting examples of use of UIStackViews.üåü
  • Bezier Path Playgrounds (‚≠ê25) - Some playgrounds to better understand UIBezierPaths.
  • UIKit playground (‚≠ê43) - Playgrounds to experiment interactively with UIKit views.
  • UIDynamic Playground (‚≠ê5) - Multiple Playgrounds using almost every behaviour of UIDynamic.
  • WWDC16 Typography (‚≠ê7) üáØüáµ - Draw a logo or any text with the WWDC16 ASCII texture.
  • Animated GIF Playground (‚≠ê1) - Swift playground for generating animated GIFs.
  • RPClarity (‚≠ê42) - Shows a technique for blurring an image behind the characters behind one or more UILabels. ‚è≥
  • Swift Clock (‚≠ê29) - An animated clock in a swift playground. ‚è≥
  • WatchKit Asset Playground (‚≠ê8) - A swift playground for creating awesome animations for your WatchKit Apps. ‚è≥
  • Swift 2.0 Protocol Extension Example (‚≠ê37) - Showing how to use Swift2 protocol extensions to render errors in UIViews and UIViewControllers without subclassing or creating classes. ‚è≥
  • Tinting (‚≠ê0) - A small playground to demonstrate image tinting in UIKit. ‚è≥
  • Ray tracing Playground (‚≠ê16) - A playground and a series of articles on ray tracing, see also part 2 (‚≠ê6), 3 (‚≠ê7), 4 (‚≠ê3), 5 (‚≠ê5) üåü ‚è≥
  • WWDC16 Logo Playground - Drawing the WWDC16 logo in a playground. ‚è≥

UIKit And Graphics / Core Image

  • Interpolation Playground (‚≠ê63) - Playground demonstrating lerp, smooth step, Catcall-Rom and others! ‚è≥
  • CoreImage for Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê89) - Growing collection of CoreImage playgrounds from the upcoming book "CoreImage For Swift". üåü ‚è≥
  • Image Processor (‚≠ê9) - Implementing different image filter algorithms. ‚è≥

UIKit And Graphics / Metal

  • METAL Playground (‚≠ê55) - Apple Metal framework playground. üåü ‚è≥

UIKit And Graphics / Animations

  • Core Animation Swift Playgrounds (‚≠ê35) - A set of interesting Core Animation playgounds.
  • UIViewPropertyAnimator Playground (‚≠ê37) - Playground demonstrating UIViewPropertyAnimator.
  • WWDC Crowd Simulator 2017 (‚≠ê32) - A SpriteKit experiment to simulate the WWDC2017 logo crowd.
  • Additive Animations (‚≠ê35) - Experiment with multiple additive animations in Core Animation. ‚è≥
  • Core Animation Playground (‚≠ê9) - Companion to Apple's Core Animation Programming Guide. ‚è≥

UIKit And Graphics / SpriteKit

  • SpriteKit Swift 3 (‚≠ê7) - Playground for exploring Sprite Kit.
  • SceneKit Examples (‚≠ê21) - Experiment with SceneKit and Swift. ‚è≥

Audio / SpriteKit

  • Bach Playground (‚≠ê4) - A Simple Swift Playground that plays a brief piece by Bach with AVAudioEngine and AVMIDIPlayer.
  • PlayerNode Playground (‚≠ê5) - Playground using AVAudioEngine with a playernode and effects to play an audio file. üåü

Mathematics / SpriteKit

  • Lindenmayer Systems (‚≠ê12) - A Swift playground exploring Lindemayer systems.
  • Swift Natural Numbers (‚≠ê3) - A playground for implementing the natural numbers and more concepts in number theory.
  • Polydoxical (‚≠ê0) - Interactive playground to experiment with roulettes and polygons.
  • Swift Accelerate (‚≠ê120) - Using the Accelerate framework and Swift for Linear Algebra. ‚è≥
  • Swifty Mathematics (‚≠ê3) - A collection of swift playground about mathematics. ‚è≥
  • Numerical Algorithms - Numerical argorithms playground from Ray Wenderlich. ‚è≥

Libraries and APIs / SpriteKit

  • AIToolbox (‚≠ê801) - A set of playgrounds showing machine learning algorithms, all implemented with pieces of the AIToolbox framework code.
  • Cognitive Service APIs (‚≠ê57) - Get started with the Microsoft Cognitive Services APIs.
  • Rx Playground (‚≠ê6) - A playground with RxSwift examples.

Playground Sets / SpriteKit

  • Public Extensions (‚≠ê299) - A set of useful extensions from @PublicExtension. üåü
  • ManuelCarlos's Playgrouds - Various playgrounds.
  • Sketchytech's Playgrounds (‚≠ê7) - Various Playgrounds. üåü ‚è≥
  • Swift fun playgrounds (‚≠ê8) - A few playgrounds to showcase Swift peculiar features. ‚è≥
  • BradLarson's Playgrounds (‚≠ê20) - Various playgrounds. ‚è≥
  • Dmikusa's Playgrounds (‚≠ê16) - Playgrounds that show basic Swift, JSON parsing, sending HTTP requests and basic file IO. ‚è≥
  • Cananito's Playgrounds (‚≠ê2) - Various playgrounds. ‚è≥
  • Uberbruns's Playgrounds (‚≠ê4) - Various playgrounds. ‚è≥

Miscellaneous / SpriteKit

  • Icon Creator (‚≠ê37) - Create app icons on Swift playground.
  • 2048 Playground (‚≠ê43) - The 2048 game implemented with a playground.
  • SwiftShell (‚≠ê21) - Bash shell in a playground.
  • LaunchPad Playground (‚≠ê5) - A playground that simulates a real LaunchPad for making music.
  • Super Maze (‚≠ê9) - A programmatic maze generator and solver.
  • Tic Tac Toe (‚≠ê7) - Tic tac toe in a playground.
  • Game Boards (‚≠ê183) - Chess, checkers, tic-tac-toe, sudoku and many others in playground. üåü ‚è≥
  • StarWars Seals (‚≠ê3) - Emblems from Star Wars in Swift playgrounds via CoreGraphics and UIViews. ‚è≥
  • SwiftFiles (‚≠ê42) - Save, Load and Delete files easily from within a Swift playground. ‚è≥
  • Earth photos (‚≠ê6) - A slideshow of Earth photos taken by DSCOVR/EPIC. üåü ‚è≥
entry.summary: 105 awesome projects updated on May 29 - Jun 04, 2017
